com.ibm.opencard.access
Interface MFCLazyAccessParser

All Known Implementing Classes:
MFC35AccessParser
public abstract interface MFCLazyAccessParser
extends MFCAccessParser

Lazy evaluation interface for access information parsing. Smartcard objects, like files or keys, typically define access conditions for all command classes distinguished by the smartcard's operating system. Most of this information is not required by an application, either because there is no command of this class that can be executed on the object, or because the application does not use any command of that class.
To avoid the overhead of creating instances of MFCAccessConditions for all command classes, parsers may implement a lazy evaluation policy. The instance of MFCAccessInformation will store the encoded access information, and parse the access conditions for a command class on demand.
While MFCAccessParser defines a generic interface for access parsers, this interface adds a method for lazy evaluation.

See Also:
MFCAccessInformation, MFCAccessConditions, MFCAccessParser

Methods inherited from interface com.ibm.opencard.access.MFCAccessParser
parseAccessInformation
 

Method Detail

parseAccessConditions

public MFCAccessConditions parseAccessConditions(byte[] data,
                                                 int offset,
                                                 int cmdclass)
                                          throws opencard.core.service.CardServiceInvalidParameterException
Interpret status information for a specific command class. Extract and return the access information encoded. Since this method does not throw a checked exception, the data to be parsed has to be checked when creating the access information.
Parameters:
data - status information to parse
offset - index of first byte of access information
cmdclass - command class for which access conditions are needed
Returns:
a Java representation of the access conditions for the specified command class
Throws:
opencard.core.service.CardServiceInvalidParameterException - if the access conditions cannot be parsed
